```{r}
setwd("~/Desktop")
c <- read.csv("~/Desktop/Bank.csv", header=TRUE,sep=",")
library(car)
summary(c)
c
str(c)
sapply(c[2:13],sd)
head(c)
tail(c)
plot(c)
plot(c$age)
plot(c$Dependents)
plot(c$DebtRatio)
hist(c$age)
hist(c$DebtRatio)
hist(c$RevolvingUtilizationOfUnsecuredLines)
hist(c$MonthlyIncome)
hist(c$OpenCreditLinesAndLoans)
hist(c$RealEstateLoansOrLines)
hist(c$TotalCeditLines)
hist(c$X30.59DaysPastDueNotWorse)
hist(c$X60.89DaysPastDueNotWorse)
plot(c$MonthlyIncome,c$age)
plot(c$age,c$DebtRatio)
plot(c$MonthlyIncome,c$DebtRatio)
plot(c$age,c$RevolvingUtilizationOfUnsecuredLines)
plot(c$TotalCeditLines,c$age)
plot(c$X30.59DaysPastDueNotWorse,c$age)

```

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r, echo=FALSE}
plot(cars)
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
